chapter.title: Installation

step.para: Download the CVS (modulename = glob2) as explained here (http://savannah.nongnu.org/cvs/?group=glob2)
Download the graphic archive as explained here (http://ysagoon.com/glob2)
Uncompress the graphic archive in the glob2/data directory
Go back In the glob2 directory, and generate configure :

If you have SDL not installed in the aclocal PATH (on Mac OS X for instance), do the following : aclocal -I /usr/local/share/aclocal, where /usr/local/share/aclocal is where SDL aclocal's macros are installed.
If SDL aclocal's macro are installed at a standard place, just run :aclocal
Then, you need to configure Glob2, run ./configure. If you want to install Glob2 in a special place, run ./configure --prefix=[place to install glob2] instead of just ./configure.
Then you have to compile Glob2, simply run make
If you want to install Glob2 system wide, do make install. Otherwise, you can launch Glob2 by typing src/glob2

chapter.para: If you take Glob2 from the distribution .tar.gz, you can untar the distribution, and then skip to step 5.
Read the README and the INSTALL files in Globulation 2 distribution for additional informations.

chapter.title: Quick introduction
chapter.para: Then click on Tutorial in the main menu and follow the tutorial. It will teach you everything you need to begin to play with Globulation 2.

chapter.title: Contributing
chapter.para: The following sections will strongly help you if you are (or wanna be) a Globulation 2 contributor.

sect1.title: Becoming a contributor
sect1.para: If you are interested in graphics/sounds/musics/web design/map design you only need to have a working Globulation 2. installation.
If you are interested in documentation, you have to additionally install the texinfo package from http://www.gnu.org/software/texinfo/the Texinfo homepage.
If you are interested in code, you need to be able to rebuild everything from CVS. So you need several packages:

listitem.para: gcc 2.95.X or gcc > 3.3.X
gmake
automake
autoconf
m4
libsdl1.2
libsdl-image1.2
libsdl-net1.2

sect1.para: Follow the instructions given in the README and INSTALL files in Globulation 2 distribution.

sect1.title: Coding guidelines
sect1.para: All the code in Globulation 2 tree should follow thoses guidelines. If you wanna contribute, first read thoses guidelines and be sure to have fully understood them. Thanks.

listitem.para: Globulation 2 is coded in C++. However, usage of the standard C library is permitted when justified for the simplicity (use of FILE * pointer in the virtual filesystem).
Always put { and } on a single line, excepted when { and } are on the same line.
Always indent with tabs. Tabs should be 4 char width.
Alternatively, you can use the following astyle command : astyle -c -t -S -b

When coding a for-like loop, put a space between arguments :
for (int i=0; i<10; i++)
.h stands for header, so put header in them. Implementation should always be placed in .cpp files, excepted :
When there is only a return (like int getValue(void) { return i; } ).
When speed is critical (isUnit(...) in Map.h for instance)
Do only put the minimum include in header files. Glob2 already takes minuts to compile. Don't let him take days.

sect2.title: Introduction
sect2.para: SGSL is a little scripting language for Globulation 2. SGSL is simple and has a very easy syntax. A SGSL script is nothing else than a list of line which are executed sequencially. The power of SGSL is it's ability to execute several script at the same time. So there can be, for instance, two differents way to win the game, and both will be valid. This is known as multi-threading-scripting (MTS).

listitem.para: show("text"): Display the text text until hide is called or show is called again.
hide: Hide the text displayed by show.
wait (condition): Stop the execution of the thread until condition is true. condition is re-evaluated at each script tick.

answer.para: Globulation 2 is a real-time strategic game which focus on middle-term goal and reduces micro-managment.

question.para: On which plateforme does Globulation 2 run ?

answer.para: Globulation 2 has successfully run on Win32 (win 95, 98, NT, 2000, XP), GNU/Linux, Mac OS X, Solaris. It should also run on other Unix.
